content.text: Trained Techniques That Define How You Fight
“Training isn’t free. Nothing in this world is. But the difference between a contractor who invested in technique and one who didn’t is usually measured in how many pieces they come home in.“

Kit abilities are trained combat techniques — not spells, not augment activations, not special attacks. They’re the things a veteran contractor knows how to do that a rookie doesn’t. Abilities don’t deal direct damage. They amplify, modify, apply conditions, buff allies, debuff enemies, and create tactical opportunities. The weapon deals the damage. The ability changes the context.

• No ability deals direct damage. Weapons handle damage. Abilities change how damage lands. • Mix of passive and active. Passives are always-on instincts. Actives cost AP and produce effects, not damage. • Pay to grow. Every ability is purchased with credits and requires training time (downtime activity). Find an instructor, pay their fee, spend downtime learning. • Wide, not deep. Each tier offers 5-6 options. Players pick 1 for free, can buy additional picks at double cost. A contractor who dumps credits into training has a LOT to choose from. • Kit-specific but not kit-locked. Cross-training into other kit trees costs triple credits and requires T3+ in your own tree first.
Additional training: Buy additional abilities from the same tier at
double base cost. A T2 pick costs 300 cr. A second T2 pick costs 600 cr. A third costs 900 cr. No limit except money and downtime.

Cross-training: Learning from another kit’s tree costs triple credits, requires T3+ in your own tree, and the ability must be at least one tier below your current tier. A T4 Berserker can buy T3 Phantom abilities. A T3 Berserker can buy T2 Phantom abilities.

rows: T1-T4. Find via Streetwise or broker.
A crewmate who has the ability can teach you. Builds crew bonds.
